main event: A civilian observed a large, oval-shaped, silent object with bright lights around the top that passed overhead at a low altitude over San Antonio, Texas on May 7, 1953.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be between 40-50 feet in diameter and had approximately 8-10 evenly spaced lights around the top that formed a perfect semi-circle.
The object moved in a straight line at a steady, constant speed of about 100 mph in a northeast direction.
The object was dark in color but was illuminated by the lights, appearing a dark gray.
The witness was amazed by the object's large size and silent movement.
The witness initially thought the lights were a star constellation but then realized they were part of a larger object.
sighted object: a large, oval-shaped object with bright lights around the top
